location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 40 of 1866 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter requesting permission to sell the Bughla that had belonged to the Shaikh of Bahrain and informing Government that the Shaikh has given warlike assistance to the Wahabees [Wahhabis] and had resumed his insulting language towards the British Government.
